newsitem.title: PERU: Peru anti-terrorist police chief believed hostage.
newsitem.headline: Peru anti-terrorist police chief believed hostage.

text.p: The current and past chiefs of Peru's anti-terrorist police, known as DINCOTE, were among hostages being held on Wednesday by Peruvian guerrillas at the Japanese ambassador's residence in Lima, another former DINCOTE head, John Caro, said.
"The information I have is that the former DINCOTE chief, Carlos Dominguez, and the current chief, Maximo Rivera, are inside (the residence)," Caro told reporters.
Also among the hostages, who could number as many as 490, were two Peruvian ministers and at least 15 foreign ambassadors.
DINCOTE sources told Reuters the guerrillas did not recognise all the hostages they held and had sought identification from their captives.
It was not known if the rebels knew they were holding the police officials.
